content: Life’s Been Nothing but Trouble and Tears

The priest Pashur son of Immer was the senior priest in ’s Temple. He heard Jeremiah preach this sermon. He whipped Jeremiah the prophet and put him in the stocks at the Upper Benjamin Gate of ’s Temple. The next day Pashur came and let him go. Jeremiah told him, “ has a new name for you: not Pashur but Danger-Everywhere, because  says, ‘You’re a danger to yourself and everyone around you. All your friends are going to get killed in battle while you stand there and watch. What’s more, I’m turning all of Judah over to the king of Babylon to do whatever he likes with them—haul them off into exile, kill them at whim. Everything worth anything in this city, property and possessions along with everything in the royal treasury—I’m handing it all over to the enemy. They’ll rummage through it and take what they want back to Babylon.

“‘And you, Pashur, you and everyone in your family will be taken prisoner into exile—that’s right, exile in Babylon. You’ll die and be buried there, you and all your cronies to whom you preached your lies.’”* * *
You pushed me into this, , and I let you do it.
And now I’m a public joke.
Every time I open my mouth
And all I get for my -warnings
But if I say, “Forget it!
The words are fire in my belly,
I’m worn out trying to hold it in.
Then I hear whispering behind my back:
Old friends watch, hoping I’ll fall flat on my face:
Curse the day
The day my mother bore me—
And curse the man who delivered
“You’ve got a new baby—a boy baby!”
Let that birth notice be blacked out,
And the man who brought it haunted to his death
He should have killed me before I was born,
My mother pregnant for the rest of her life
Why, oh why, did I ever leave that womb?
